channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees in need of urgent watering, 10th August
item.description:
I believe this issue was already reported back in June, but zero action has been taken. I took those photos today and you can clearly see the dying trees that require instant intervention. It's a shame that the cost of a single tree that size with a planter around Â£600-1200 is so easily neglected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, West Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bank subsidance and tree stumps falling into parked cars, 10th August
item.description:
The bank over time has deteriorated with loose crazy paving slabs and now signs of subsidence. Craters developing where trees were planted (stumps remain) that are rotten and one which has been placed on grass verge. General upkeep is poor (over the last 20 years or so) with unsightly weeds and structural deterioration. Poses a risk to car damage and trip hazards. This problem is getting worse year on year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repair carried out, poor, 10th August
item.description:
The repair was recently carried out in a disgraceful manner, unprofessional and cowboy! I was walking out of my driveway and the bit before the slabs are raised, I nearly injured my knee. This needs to be correctly repaired, I nearly tripped. I am considering to seek legal advice. This is a hazard directly outside my house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmhurst Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous: northbound cycle lane markings not visible, 10th August
item.description:
The northbound cycle lane markings on this stretch of road (The Pavement, Clapham Old Town) are not visible to road users. This means users of motor vehicle particularly cars, lorries, coaches and motorbikes travelling southbound on The Pavement drive on or straddle into the northbound cycle lane. They do not expect cyclist traffic and so drive head on towards northbound cyclists. This is dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27-31, The Pavement, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
